subject: RE: [junit] Should tests follow the code...?
msgSnippet: ... make ... Yes, that was my feeling.  My only (slight) worry is that this type of thing happens over time, so there seems to be a risk of forgetting that
messageBody:
JB replied:

> > How do other people handle this type of refactoring and unit test
> > management and what they do?

> As B grows, you'll start to add tests for B on its own, which will
make
> it easier to notice that some of its tests are here and others are
> there. If this becomes a problem -- and it isn't always -- that's the
> point at which I'd start moving tests.

Yes, that was my feeling. My only (slight) worry is that this type of
thing happens over time, so there seems to be a risk of "forgetting"
that you've got some of these tests somewhere else. That said if
additional functionality then breaks those tests then I guess (as you
said) that's the time to move/change them.

> Now it seems that A instantiates B directly, based on your
description.
> If that's true, then I would consider refactoring A to allow me to
> inject B into it, and see how the tests would change. Perhaps YAGNI,
and
> as you say, you need to spend your time on other things; however, my
> designs have always suffered from too /many/ hardcoded dependencies,
and
> not too /few/.

Agreed, actually I've already done this - so I now have two types of
tests for A - those that implicitly use the actual functionality of B
(because that's what it's supposed to do) and those where I seed the
behaviour of B to allow me to test code flow.

It's a struts-based application so these second set of tests allow me to
check that given certain behaviours of B, A forwards to the relevant
page. I know I *could* do this with struts-unit or some such like, but
at the moment I think that is another level of complexity I have yet to
get to (and I think it's too heavy for my current requirement). I
currently "get away with" having my Action delegate to some other
class(es) which I TDD, so then what's left is checking my Action
forwards to where I want it to go to given some stimulus...

Thanks

Jonathan
